description: {"blocks":[{"key":"87llf","text":"PURPOSE: Step-by-step instructions for checking WGS sequence quality for bacterial pathogens. The MicroRunQC workflow, implemented in a custom Galaxy instance, will produce quality assessments for raw reads (Illumina paired-end fastq files) and draft de novo assemblies, along with reporting the sequence type for each isolate. This workflow will work on most microbial pathogens, so we advise laboratories to upload their entire MiSeq/NextSeq run through this workflow.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu6ll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbkp3","text":"SCOPE: This protocol covers the following tasks:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dkbl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u4c9","text":"1. set up an account in GalaxyTrakr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aogh5","text":"2. Create a new history/workspace","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4jat","text":"3. Upload data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc3th","text":"4. Execute the MicroRunQC workflow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b90u9","text":"5. Interpret the results - check against GenomeTrakr QC thresholds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e56gt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br865","text":"Version updates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86v5e","text":"V3: updated with Cronobacter thresholds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mto2","text":"V4: MicroRunQC updated to V1.1 Includes updates to skeza and mlst methods, as well as adjusted assembly QC thresholds for E.coli. Added Enterobacter QC thresholds to threshold table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":136,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhd21","text":"V5: New column in the output table to capture additional mlst data fields when available in Sequence Type definition files (not available for all species)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5qp0","text":"Please note that this protocol is public domain, which supersedes the CC-BY license default used by protocols.io.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: WGS, Quality Control, GalaxyTrakr, GenomeTrakr, microbial pathogen survielliance
manuscript_citation: Timme, R. E., W. J. Wolfgang, M. Balkey, S. L. G. Venkata, R. Randolph, M. Allard, and E. Strain. 2020. Optimizing open data to support one health: best practices to ensure interoperability of genomic data from bacterial pathogens. One Health Outlook 2: 20.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aq47c","text":"Create a GalaxyTrakr account here: https://account.galaxytrakr.org/Account/Register","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o4pk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k8et","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agr7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8EAFDA816CF84B7880984A627007DC45","url":"https://account.galaxytrakr.org/Account/Register"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"343565605EA911EAAC84F5250F874054","height":316.1090909090909,"id":380919,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 1.18.17 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyqu9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv9z9yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv9y9yen.webp","width":543.3124999999994}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"428nh","text":"Log into your GalaxyTrakr account: https://galaxytrakr.org","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"3gnnr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftdp9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6t63","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"54CC23E79D82494FABBE2982DE5F9B5F","url":"https://galaxytrakr.org"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"956A7F505EA911EAAC84F5250F874054","height":255.47636363636357,"id":380921,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 1.20.59 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyqw9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv939yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv929yen.webp","width":487.8888888888889}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ec3i1","text":"Create a new history. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"db98d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dcvg6","text":"We recommend creating a new history for each new MiSeq Run and including the flow-cell ID and date in the history name. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6vg1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"i63a","text":"Save your MicroRunQC output here and any other relevant analyses, like serotyping, or AMR detection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54tc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7o0hh","text":"After all the analysis output from this run is saved to your internal data network or computer, older history's should be purged/deleted so as not to occupy the limited storage space in your account. In some cases it may be useful to save, for a limited time, multiple histories or to run analyses concurrently in multiple histories. In these cases you need to pay attention to your % usage bar (shows % used of allocated storage space) in the upper right corner of the GalaxyTrakr page. If you need additional space you can contact galaxytrakrsupport@fda.hhs.gov and request additional storage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":533,"length":30}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"733BD230234411EA9B812F7E353E6819","url":"http://galaxytrakrsupport@fda.hhs.gov"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77diu","text":"Click on the + icon in the upper right History panel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej9nc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qmus","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9D8E0FE01B7811EAAFD84D13AAE6DB35","height":159,"id":380923,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"CreateHistory.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyqy9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv959yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv949yen.webp","width":246}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vo10","text":"Name your new History by clicking on the “Unnamed history”, type in desired name and hit enter.  We recommend including the run cell ID and the date the run was started.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ef02l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a7j9j","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F747BA401B7811EAAFD84D13AAE6DB35","height":217,"id":380925,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"NameHistory.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyq29yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv979yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv969yen.webp","width":246}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bpjju","text":"This section will describe the process for uploading raw fastq files into your active History panel. After the files have been uploaded they will stay in your account until they are deleted. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2dvu","text":"Click on the Upload Data icon on the top of the left web page to start an upload process.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3fb6","text":"   ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4d1kk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EC972230C34911EDA242C57C9B10615A","height":163,"id":380927,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-03-15 at 11.54.39 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwab9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv999yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaa9yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mv989yen.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15k5v","text":"Select \"Type (set all):auto-detect.\" Choose local file button and navigate to the desired fastq files, then click \"start\" to upload files. These files should be paired (two per sample/isolate).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"al76v","text":"   ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bv2ke","text":"As the file uploads complete, each row will turn green. Samples in yellow are still in process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8DFE7ED05F0611EAAC84F5250F874054","height":333,"id":380931,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"GalaxyTrakr-dataupload.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyq89yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwad9yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwac9yen.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gfte","text":"You have just upload a set of forward and reverse reads.  For further analysis these files need to be paired properly so the platform knows which R1 and R2 files go with each sample/isolate.  GalaxyTrakr does this by creating a List of Dataset Pairs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":228,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hiq3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ch5m","text":"Within your newly created History panel, click the \"check box,\" then select all the files you just uploaded by clicking \"All\" or by individually selecting the ones you want to pair.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k5v5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"270kk","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B31540B05F2311EAAC84F5250F874054","height":277.81202487602906,"id":380933,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9ikev\",\"text\":\"Screenshot of History panal showing recently uploaded files.  Note the way the files are named, using R1 and R2 to identify the paired reads. This will be important in the next step.  Some naming conventions can be slightly different.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":60}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 3.50.08 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyra9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaf9yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwae9yen.webp","width":185.95033328375487}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bh1q","text":"Click \"For all selected\" and choose \"Build List of Dataset Pairs\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"da4vc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fr5km","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b79c5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"55103B905F2411EAAC84F5250F874054","height":366.10885519308385,"id":380935,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"BuildDatasetPairs.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyrc9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwah9yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwag9yen.webp","width":222.47125689652734}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ilr2","text":"A new window will open to help you pair the fastq files properly.  Note how your paired reads are named.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gq79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sp3m","text":"First, click on the drop downarrow and choose “_R1”. This automatically chooses “_R2” in the next box.​","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vgi9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r2e9","text":" Click Auto-pair.  Paired reads will pair in the middle column and turn green. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fvkvv","text":" Unclick \"Hide original elements\".  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A0343F700AAE11EE9046C1282F3CC197","height":283,"id":380937,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-06-14 at 8.25.54 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwam9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaj9yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwak9yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwai9yen.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E76B24D00AAE11EE9046C1282F3CC197","height":306,"id":380941,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-06-14 at 8.22.44 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwar9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwap9yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaq9yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwan9yen.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"590BE3900AAF11EE954733B22CDEDCD5","height":286,"id":380945,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-06-14 at 8.22.53 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwav9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwat9yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwau9yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwas9yen.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"53m4d","text":"Name your dataset:  Example, \"pairedSet-\u003cFlowCell\u003e-\u003cdate\u003e\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a5jn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhiuc","text":"Click Create list.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"astb4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eubh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C5B0DD805F2611EAAC84F5250F874054","height":517,"id":380949,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"NamePairedDateset.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kyri9yen.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwax9yen.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaw9yen.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2flr5","text":"This paired dataset will now be available for analysis in your history panel. You can run multiple analyses on the same dataset in a history rather than upload the same sequence data to a new history to perform additional analyses. This will help you use your allocated storage space efficiently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc2u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pgsa","text":"You can re-name this PairedList by clicking on the name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4p9s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qdh2","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"558D82C0C35411EDA242C57C9B10615A","height":321,"id":380951,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-03-15 at 1.09.18 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa39yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwaz9yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa29yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mway9yen.webp","width":186.5531062124249}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nio0","text":"Add the MicroRunQC workflow to your own \"workflows\" panel.  You only have to do this step once for each new workflow you need.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"99kdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15emp","text":"Navigate to the “Shared Data\" drop down menu, choose workflows and locate \"MicroRunQC_v1.2\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qv69","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gi6q","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b05g0","text":"From Dropdown, select \"Import\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6iet2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n4p8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2CF5054009E511EE86070D5C6D9FD2E0","height":481,"id":380959,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-06-13 at 8.22.12 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwbb9yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa99yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwba9yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa89yen.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4FBAD87009E511EE86070D5C6D9FD2E0","height":169,"id":380955,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-06-13 at 8.24.44 AM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa79yen.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa59yen.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa69yen.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mwa49yen.webp","width":325}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqv32","text":" The MicroRunQC output file includes the following columns:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7la1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s62b","text":"Parameter Input Description Contigs Assembly Number of contigs in the de-novo SKESA assembly. Contigs smaller than 200 base-pairs (bp) are not counted.  Length Assembly Total length of all contigs \u003e 200bp. This should approximate the size of the genome for the target organism. EstCov Assembly Mean coverage for contigs in the SKESA assembly. N50 Assembly Sequence length of the shortest contig at 50% of the total genome length MedianInsert Read Distance between forward and reverse reads. Calculated by mapping reads to SKESA assembly using bwa. MeanLength_R1 Read Mean length of forward read MeanLength_R2 Read Mean length of reverse read MeanQ_R1 Read Mean Q-score of forward read MeanQ_R2 Read Mean Q-score of reverse read Scheme Assembly PubMLST (pubmlst.org) database scheme (e.g. senterica for Salmonella enterica) ST Assembly Sequence Type  Loci Assembly gene (allele number) – for example aroC(118) ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":153,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":278,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":343,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":429,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":548,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":595,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":642,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":685,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":728,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":823,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":850,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":886}],"data":{}},{"key":"22tn9","text":" of contigs in the de-novo SKESA assembly. Contigs smaller than 200 base-pairs (bp) are not counted.\u0026nbsp;"],["\u003cb\u003eLength\u003c/b\u003e","Assembly","Total length of all contigs \u0026gt; 200bp. This table lists the summary metrics for sequence quality, number of contigs, and estimated genome size, along with other common metrics for reads (Median Insert Size and Mean Length) and assemblies (N50).  Additionally, if the Multi-Locus Sequence Type (MLST) for the isolate is available from pubmlst, the workflow also reports Sequence Type (ST) and the associated alleles.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"44rgt","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"47e0a","text":"*MLST extra.:Additional data fields reported when available in Sequence Type definition files (not available for all species)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":87,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bq2ie","text":"1. clonal_complex – sequences grouped by similarity to central allelic profile  (e.g., Campylobacter ST-21 complex)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":61,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5ekn7","text":"2. CC – clonal_complex – Abbreviation used for organism like Listeria, ST profiles are maintained by different groups","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":22,"offset":13,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dk2nu","text":"3.
